description: From Middle English begilen, begylen; equivalent to be- +‎ guile. Compare Middle Dutch begilen (“to beguile”). Doublet of bewile.

verbs.description: beguile (third-person singular simple present beguiles, present participle beguiling, simple past and past participle beguiled)

examples: I feel how weak and fruitless must be any words of mine which should attempt to beguile you from the grief of a loss so overwhelming.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause (time) to seem to pass quickly, by way of pleasant diversion.
